Class Song

  • java.lang.Object
    • Song
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Song
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class represents a Song object that has a name and a sequence of notes. It also can detect whether it has started in the play-along feature.
    Version:
    5/23/16
    Author:
    Julie Shen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Song(java.lang.String name, int[] notes, Piano piano)
      This constructor creates a Song object with a name, notes, and a piano passed in as arguments.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getHasStarted() 
      java.lang.String getName() 
      int[] getNotes() 
      void playAlong()
      Starts the play-along feature in the program.
      void run()
      Allows the play-along feature to run in a new Thread.
      void setHasStarted(boolean b) 
      void startThread()
      Starts a new Thread to allow the play-along feature to run simultaneously while the keys are being pressed.
      void stopThread()
      Stops the Thread by stopping the play-along feature.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Song

        public Song(java.lang.String name,
            int[] notes,
            Piano piano)
        This constructor creates a Song object with a name, notes, and a piano passed in as arguments.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the song
        notes - An array of integers indicating the sequence of keys to be pressed
        piano - A Piano object that is used

    • Method Detail

      • getNotes

        public int[] getNotes()

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()

      • setHasStarted

        public void setHasStarted(boolean b)

      • getHasStarted

        public boolean getHasStarted()

      • playAlong

        public void playAlong()
        Starts the play-along feature in the program. Each key in the sequence of notes lights up red for the User to follow.

      • startThread

        public void startThread()
        Starts a new Thread to allow the play-along feature to run simultaneously while the keys are being pressed.

      • stopThread

        public void stopThread()
        Stops the Thread by stopping the play-along feature.

      • run

        public void run()
        Allows the play-along feature to run in a new Thread. Runs when the Thread begins.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
